title: So malzahar voidlings are "reworked"
body:
And of course its a heavy nerf without compensation. Of course its clueless rickless.
Voidling die with one champ AA, does not gain movementspeed. 150 cast range. NO power added to QE or even R, and you only gains stacks after you cast spells.

What happened to the "we will reward mid malz" part? You just nerfed the whole entire champion as a whole. How the heck im supposed to use this champion anymore? His ult bot status is magnified since everything is nerfed aside from his busted passive you should remove.

This is honestly a slap in the face for Malzahar players and I seriously question what the rework team is doing, and if they are getting payed for how long they can draw out this train wreck.

They need to return to square one and remember **why** people liked to play original Malzahar instead of abuse his gameplay. Turn this rework concept into a new Champion is they love it that much.

if the enemy adc just kills them, then perhaps the change did work

theres no reason to use malzahar ANYWHERE. 
You realize the reason malzahar even went support was because he lacked the ability to kill on his own, right? 
He COULD do damage, but it took a lot of poking and a lot of enemy mistakes and a LOT of mana to kill on his own. 
His lack of lethality - the ability to kill - is what made him such a stellar support. Couple that with the fact that his ult is a long "Forced 1v2" and no longer relies on AP to be useful, you get someone who has been tailored for the support role as a "harass support". 

What malzahar NEEDS is ALL OF HIS NERFS reverted and to be using the current live version of his W. 
He also needs a new passive that isnt either blatantly OP or one of the worst defensive passives in the game. 

What this means is;
Basic attack range nerf reverted
Move speed nerf reverted
Voidlings no longer lose movement speed
Voidlings enrage properly  
Voidlings have 3 hits to them and empowered auto attacks count as one hit
Voidlings no longer have an internal cooldown between charges
Voidlings no longer have 50% reduced damage against monsters

ALL of those things need to be done before malzahar can even remotely be viable. 
The ENTIRE "MALZAHAR OP OP OP OP!!!!!" thing comes from malzahar being an objective focused jungler in an objective intense meta. He was scary and safe - but his ganks were terrible pre-6 and even post 6 he was just a kill enabler. People just hyper focused because "OMG LEVEL 2 DRAGON!!! OP OP OP!!!!" =/

With everything you laid out, the only options really are revert or rework.

Currently, my money and time are only going to go to the former.

It's going to be neither.
Since there will be more Malzahar changes in the next week.

Good thing this entire thread probably lacks the [context RecklessAbandon clearly tweeted about after posting these changes](https://twitter.com/ricklessabandon/status/860648469421215745) but the boards as usual, are already setting off dumpster fires while working with half of the information...

Why should we bother following tweets and reddit posts when Riot has their own official boards to relay information about their own damn game on? You want to take your jab at "the boards" but this is where information should be posted. I'm not going to follow a tool to maybe catch a random update blurb just because Riot wants their own boards to die.

I've gotten this information from [Surrender at 20](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2017/05/55-pbe-update.html#balance) which is basically the only site you should be looking for where every bit of League news is condensed in one place because i, like you, only care about the boards and no other social outlet.

Riot does post here (as well as reddit because that's where people are the most) and the boards probably don't support twitter feeds. So this is why some bits of information or context can go unnoticed, if a Rioter posts after the changes have been made to something.

Not reading Surrender at 20 is no excuse for you to be lazy.

"Not reading a third-party website is no excuse."

Um. Yes. It is. Never before, in any game I played, did the developers expect their playerbase to go searching on third-party sites for information. Never before did other developers actually *link* to third-party or fan-sites for information they had no excuse for being absent on their own official boards.

Obscure information? Loot drop tables? Probabilities? Theory-crafting? Sure, all of those should be on third-party sites because they tend to have no real bearing on the game's playability or updates. But direct changes to the game? Patch notes? Feedback threads referencing the changes created by the developer in charge of the changes? These belong on the boards, and by and large, most of these kinds of updates are finding themselves on Reddit and various other third-party websites.

I'm not going on an egg hunt for official update information about a game that should be on said game's official boards. That's what the boards are for. I do not care if Surrender at 20 is an aggregate site dedicated to amassing scattered bits of information into a single localized place -- that single localized place *should be the official boards*.

Again, the only site you should be looking at the condensed information is Surr at 20.
It doesn't take any time to look through all the changes, updates, announcements (which is exactly the same information you get here but it gets scattered everywhere because not all people are on boards).

Riot is not going to post everything here because it's more convenient for you.
For other people, subreddit is a lot more popular and populated among League players and the same information is being posted on both sides (but the discussions over various social outlets don't port to others). Outside of some Rioters linking the discussion or bringing it here to us, you're not going to see Rioters rushing to copy-paste everything from one outlet to every other outlet.

Don't be lazy.
It's not even an easter egg hunt, it's one click away from you. If you don't want to read that information that's provided, don't bother trying to start half-assed discussions about changes you only have partial information from. Don't add to shitposting.
no he has a point. riot has a forum, riot should use the forum.

Never said he didn't have a point.
But he's approaching this issue from his point of convenience, ignoring the fact that what's convenient for him might not be convenient for other people. And what he's proposing is that Riot should forcefully condense all of the information on their boards in order to force people to use them.

And to that i say Riot did the only thing that's easier and that was to be flexible and post on more than one location. As i've said, Rioters aren't going to run from board to board, copy-pasting the discussions so that everyone can see them. If it's a discussion on reddit, it's gonna be on reddit. If it's a discussion here, it's going to be here. More or less, Rioters can share the links on each site about the venue of the said discussions and who wants to participate, can do so freely. Even so, Rioters sometimes do come and answer some of the threads here, even if there are mirror threads on reddit.

What's even more astounding is that even if Surrender at 20 is a third-party site, it's very well integrated into the LoL community, even more so than reddit. Moobeat and the crew are well known among Rioters. So you only actually need to visit one place for all the information (Surrender at 20) and check back if any of the links to specific discussions are had here,  to participate on your only medium of choice.

That's case in point for "if all the info about LoL was here, everyone would read it" argument because they still wouldn't.



This isn't an argument about Riot not needing to make boards into a hub for all LoL related information. But it isn't a priority as there are other alternatives who do a very good job at that. And that means Riot doesn't have to rush to fix this because they sure as hell have more pressing matters to attend to - like making sure the new client is stable and working for everyone and delivering new features for it. I've read that, and I can already see the path they are moving in and I don't want to see another Ryze rework. Malzahar was one of the most stable champions in League until this rework.

>Malzahar was one of the most stable champions in League until this rework.

Well, you claimed I was wrong, so I decided to verify my claim with some research and data.

**Changes Prior to Rework**

5.24 Null Zone damage reduced from 4/8% to 4/6%
4.8 Global ultimate cost reduction 150 to 100
4.5 Global armor adjustment, new effect Voidling targeting

So three changes since Season 1 and you claim he wasn't one of the most stable stable champions in the game? How many, _if any_ have been as stable as Malzahar over that amount of time?

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Mercy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5etkz0Nw,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2017-05-06T08:05:07.980+0000)
>
> Some could argue the health of his Anti-assassin side before the rework (coming from someone who played him a lot back then).

THe people who argue the health of him being an anti assassin are champions who were either all-ins (other assassins, melee burst champs, etc) or squishies who would be assassinated (by an assassin). 
Most of those people only see "100-0 NO COUNTERPLAY MAGE WTFBBQSAUCETREEFROG" and not "Oh i just got assassinated by an AP assassin" like they should be, because malzahar is like nasus and pre-reworks sona. He had a surface playstyle that riot and the people who complained never got past. 
That was the real problem, i think, and what made them consider malzahar for a rework in the first place. Beyond their "change for the sake of change" policy, they never get below the surface and see a champion for what they really are. When they DO manage to get identities right you get great reworks like poppy and warwick. Hell warwick and poppy werent even normal reworks for riot; They actually RESPECTED the original designs intents, unlike almost ALL other reworks riot has been doing ever since sion.  

Which brings me to another problem. Riots lack of respect for their previous designs and choices. We should have traditional sion, traditional poppy, traditional warwick. But because riot doesnt respect their past and bumble along within their own "yes space" of people who have worked together for so long and therefore agree with each other they dont even acknowledge their own mistakes most of the time and scramble to fix massive problems by creating EVEN MORE MASSIVE problems.
Case and point; malzahar. More nerfs since his rework than he had changes since release pre-rework. Thats more nerfs in a YEAR or so than he had IN THREE. Swain was much the same way, but thankfully didnt get hit to hard. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Also to clarify about traditional skins; traditional skins are homages to what relaunched champions were in the past. Theyre skins that look similar to their past self, and have their old VO when applicable. 
Traditional sion right now is a custom skin which uses a default skin edit someone made in about an hour, and the old sion voice files for example. Riot could probably bang out a legitimate traditional sion in a couple days, or even a month if they make it someones pet project. The same applies to almost every other relaunched champion.

Poppy was a complete Re-do from the ground up, and Warwick just needed his theme solidified, thematically. Neither of them can be compared to Malzahar's gameplay update, because both of them had separate intents. If you're saying that Malz needs a Warwick level update, most certainly, but not the other way around. 

Moving on to the rest, I don't care what people complained about. Even as someone who played Malzahar, he had some design problems. Little to no room for outplay, his first back for some AP let him easily push waves with E, and pretty much stopped an entire class of Champion with a click and point nuke. The most fun for myself, and sometimes my opponent, was when I accidentally summoned a Voidling that saved my life, a "Get down Mr President" ~~though yes, nuking people with click and point was fun for me~~

Now, let's move on to "original design intent". Just because something was there first, doesn't mean it's the immediate right choice, especially when it has problems. Riot has made plenty mistakes in "Original design" like Vlad before his Mage update, which ended up creating a champion that was either over oppressive or just dreadful. 

You also specify two different notions of "original design" when you talk about the champions reworks, while still using two separate comparisons one shouldn't make. Poppy's original design was kept from a Thematic standpoint, which fit into her gameplay. You then use that as a comparison as it should be with Malzahar, who stayed the same thematically, and only got changed in a gameplay sense. Two very different things being compared here, with unfair standards applied to one. 

I'm gonna say this, and I know this is gonna be hard to hear, but that's absolute bullshit. Riot doesn't have a respect for previous design choices, because they have *grown* in the quality of their content, and see the older things they made a long time ago as a stepping stone, but one that has not aged well at all. They are perfectly fine ditching what they once made, in favor for a newer better version of the same thing, something they can say "I'm proud of this" instead of "Oh, well that was a long time ago". 

Traditional skins for Poppy, Sion, and Warwick is one of the dumbest requests I've heard from people, because there is absolutely nothing worth keeping from those older versions. Old Sion was a meme, Old Poppy was a nightmare AND a meme, and Old Warwick **IS THE EXACT SAME AS NEW WARWICK**. They respect the past, but they don't oogle at it and put it up on a stand. They take it off the shelf, put it in Storage, and put out the newer version of it that they put more work into than the old one. (Ex. Lollipoppy original face on the Lollipop). 

Aside from the Rant of that... you talk about a "yes space", which irks me for two reasons. One being, you act like just because people agree with Riot, they are somehow linked to an inherent bias, so their opinions should be worth less. Second being, that the people who are in the "No group" are inherently right, and can no way be wrong. Yes, Riot ignores what people wants, but sometimes what people want is not what Riot has in planned. 

Riot did not want Malzahar to be so click and point nukey, yet people argue that's what they want. I've seen this a lot, like people complaining about Leblanc's delay times, when Riot's specific mentions are about giving people more time to react. This is Riot ignoring people who want to keep the unhealthy aspects of a champion, because that is what they are accustomed too, and have assigned to be the original design for the champion. 

Riot ignoring people is not wrong. People play what they want, and like what they play for a reason, and they don't want to see that changed. But those are people we shouldn't listen to, the people who want insta-gib Leblanc, insta-gib Rengar and for no reason other than "This is how the champion has always been!". It's not an objective look on their own champions and the problems that plague them. 

So yes, Malzahar has gotten more nerfs in one year than he has three years prior, but that doesn't mean that Old Malzahar was spotless. He had problems, and the rework has been trying to tackle those problems, but it's been a trial. There is no reason to stop doing something because it's challenging, especially when it's on a good path from intentions.

/midnight rant over

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Mercy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5etkz0Nw,comment-id=00060000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-06T10:30:33.910+0000)

Okay so a couple things. 
"Relaunch" is a VGU - a visual and gameplay update. It still includes a rework, but yes youre right that they ARE very different. for clarity however i use "rework". 

Malzahar, in the first place, didnt need the scope of the changes he got. He was FAR more balanced PRE-REWORK. His niche was anti-assassin; he was the ONLY successful anti-assassin in the game. Now hes a support because its very hard for him to kill people on his own. 
His problems pre-rework were a relatively useless W, which could have been replaced with a skill shot or an active voiding on a charge system, and very little incentive to interact. Hint hint by the way, AHRI also has that same problem. Little reason to interact except to get a kill. 

Original design intent and respect for past concepts refers to "Do we modernize or bastardize a champion." Poppy? She functions the SAME WAY as she did pre-rework; dash in, smack someone, kill them or walk out. She was modernized, and her new kit heavily respected her past kit. POPPY WAS GIVEN CHANGES THAT SHE NEEDED. Warwick is the same; he was modernized. Thats why those reworks turned out so good. THEY DIDNT ALIENATE THE EXISTING PLAYERBASE. 
A prime example of "modernize or bastardize" is shen. Shen needed actual scalings and a visual update. However, instead of modernizing, the person in charge of his rework "bastardized" him. He turned shen into WHAT HE WANTED without respecting the original vision; this alienated the existing playerbase and proved very difficult to balance. Shen is still getting severe nerfs NOW.

Traditional skins are homages to the past; theyre quick, easy, and ALL they do is tell players "there used to be something different here, but we made it into something else." Trundle, karma, and sejauni -all VGUS, proto relaunches - HAVE traditional skins. Sion was the first who didnt, and riots excuse was "its to hard" when a myriad of lunchbreak custom skins for it were released in the following weeks. 
Riot SHOULD respect the past, because its THOSE decisions that made them what they are. For people that were there, people who had fun, people who devoted time and money to something in the past that object of their focus BEING FLAT REMOVED is a slap in the face. 
I say this as a once-sion main, the pain of losing a champion i enjoyed tremendously would have been greatly asauged is riot even acknowledged the existence of him pre-rework. 
Its the work of an hour to put together a skin with the old VO. Its the work of a couple days to made a good skin based on the old default. Its the work of maybe a week - a month in a professionals off-time - to put together a traditional skin. And that month is being generous; highschoolers put together traditional sion in a lunch break or two. 

>Traditional skins for Poppy, Sion, and Warwick is one of the dumbest requests I've heard from people, because there is absolutely nothing worth keeping from those older versions. 

The old VO. Some people are very attatched to a champions personality and it feels terrible to lose it, especially if you dont like the new one. 
You know what traditional sion is? A color swap and some extra armor elements. His old VO. 
You know what traditional poppy is? A battle dress. Would take more effort to do, but eh. Also her old VO. 
You know what traditional warwick is? His old VO and his fur being a brighter blue.  
It takes a little extra work, but for people who put in time and effort to what they were, that little nod of riot to them feels so nice.
